title: Ewen Crouch can't shake Morgans at Corporate Travel
text:
Corporate Travel Management lodged its FY19 report and notice of its November 6 annual meeting with the ASX late on Monday.

In his first letter to shareholders, chairman Ewen Crouch promised “a close review of the company’s governance processes and protocols” following a series of staggering disclosure failures that overwhelmed his predecessor Tony Bellas and then engulfed chief executive Jamie Pherous.

“Shareholders can be assured of the Board’s commitment to good governance,” Crouch wrote.

How can they be assured? Crouch retains Suzanne Yeates, the company secretary who presided over those failures and simultaneously serves in the same role at three other listed companies, two (Novonix and IntelliHR Holdings) chaired by Bellas and the third (State Gas) where he’s deputy chair.

And the Explanatory Memorandum appended to the Notice of AGM proves Crouch’s words entirely empty. On Resolution 4 to elect Sophie Mitchell a director of the company, we are told that “Ms Mitchell is considered by the Board to be an Independent Director.”

But Mitchell is also a director of Morgans Holdings (Australia) Limited, where she worked for 25 years until March 2018.
description: Given the chairman's solemn promise of good governance, we half expected him to deliver it. Wrong!
